Chinese authorities are uneasy about Saudi Arabia’s recent defense agreement with Pakistan, reports the South China Morning Post.

🔍 What’s the issue? China has strong ties with both countries and is actively involved in Saudi Arabia’s civilian nuclear program.

The Saudi Arabia-Pakistan pact, signed in September, stipulates that any aggression against either signatory will be considered an act of aggression against both.

Joint deterrence envisages all military means, hinting at the potential extension of Pakistan’s nuclear umbrella to Saudi Arabia.

"In the UK in 2024, you had to vaccinate 7,000 people over age 90 to prevent one severe hospitalization — while the harm rate was at least 1 in 800," he added.

🔍 Israel's secret psy-op to crown king in Iran 💥💥💥

Israel is involved in a covert digital influence campaign in the Persian language, promoting Reza Pahlavi, son of Iran’s last Shah — and subtly pushing for the return of the monarchy inside the Islamic Republic, The Haaretz reports.

📑 The campaign’s tools:

🔴 Dozens (if not hundreds) of fake accounts on X and Instagram

🔴 AI-generated content

🔴 Fake influencers posing as Iranian citizens

🔴  Native Persian speakers recruited to make it appear authentic

🔴  Posts timed to Israeli military operations — with some content ready before the bombs dropped

The campaign shows signs of being run by the Israeli government or contractors, including:

🟥 Promotion of hashtags that support Reza Pahlavi

🟥 Cross-promotion of Israeli minister Gila Gamliel, a Pahlavi ally

🟥 Tight synchronization with Israel’s 12-day war with Iran in June 2025, including pre-planned content ahead of the Evin Prison strike

items.title: 🚨🇺🇸🇮🇷 IRAN: The final domino in the globalists' pl...
items.content_text:
🚨🇺🇸🇮🇷 IRAN: The final domino in the globalists' plan for the Great Reset?

The 12 Day War was just the beginning. There are growing signs that the US and Israel are setting the groundwork for a new massive attack on Iran.

THE BUILD-UP IS UNMISTAKABLE:

🔸Tanker Deployment: Dozens of US KC-135 & KC-46 refueling tankers are now in Qatar. These are not defensive assets; they are the lifeline for long-range strike operations.

🔸Carrier Strike Group: The USS Gerald R. Ford is positioned in the Mediterranean, a classic pre-escalation move.

🔸Legal Pretext: New executive orders are effectively internationalizing potential conflict zones, setting the stage for a wider war.

🔸Regional Betrayal: Key nations are falling in line, isolating Iran economically and politically.

The pattern is identical to the run-ups in Iraq and Libya. But Iran is a different beast entirely.

IRAN'S ASYMMETRIC TRUMP CARD:

Iran doesn’t have to win outright. If Iran succeeds in imposing an unacceptably high price on its enemies, that could be enough to squeak out a bloody victory. 

The Strait of Hormuz—a 21-mile wide chokepoint for 20% of the world's oil—is their lever. Closing it, even partially, would trigger an immediate global economic earthquake: oil prices would triple, inflation would spiral, and shipping would halt.

THE ENDGAME? A GLOBAL RESET

A major conflict creates the perfect crisis to usher in a new system:

🔸Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)

🔸Mandatory Digital IDs

🔸A system of programmable money and control, sold to the public as "stability."

BOTTOM LINE:

This is bigger than Iran. It's a battle for the future of the global order. The outcome will determine whether we move toward multipolarity or a new, digital form of authoritarianism.

@NewRulesGeo❗️Follow us on X

items.content_text:
🚨🪖 Palantir stock drops like a rock on news that its new battlefield communications system is broken

The infamous military AI, drone tech and domestic surveillance-focused tech giant saw its market value slump over 8% on Friday over the publication of a Reuters story citing an Army memo revealed its system’s serious flaws.

Palantir rebuked the report, assuring that the issues (security flaws, lack of control over who sees what or what users are doing) have already been addressed, and that there are “no vulnerabilities” in the platform.

🤡 The Army’s ambitious battlefield communications network concept, created by Palantir and others, is designed to connect troops, vehicles, sensors and commanders in real time to facilitate with battlefield management.

Palantir’s bad day on Wall Street comes as founder Peter Thiel keeps busy with his private, four-part lecture series on the antichrist.

items.title: 🇺🇸🇻🇪 US preparing to seize ports and airfields in ...
items.content_text:
🇺🇸🇻🇪 US preparing to seize ports and airfields in Venezuela as Trump’s fake ‘drug war’ simmers - reports

🔊 The US has assembled forces in the Caribbean that Pentagon planners expect to be “sufficient to seize and hold key strategic facilities such as ports and airfields on Venezuelan territory,” the Washington Examiner has reported.

The US deployment includes a Navy flotilla consisting at least four destroyers and an attack submarine, 10 F-35 jets, and the 22nd Marine Expeditionary Unit (2.2k Marines and Harrier jets), with Puerto Rico serving as the staging area.

The paper suggests Marines could be backed up by Airborne infantry units flown in from the continental US, including elements of the 75th Ranger Regiment and the 82nd Airborne Division on permanent standby.

The outlet suspects the buildup doesn’t match the administration’s “drug enforcement” claims.

💬 “The current deployment structure is just too big, too expensive, and too varied in capabilities for it to be designed for that mission alone. The intent may be to intimidate Maduro, but Maduro is rightfully concerned that more direct action looms.”

⚔️ Venezuela’s president has warned that the country is “ready for a fight, if it’s necessary,” and said that militia forces have been deployed in hundreds of areas across the country. 

Venezuela boasts a 4.5 million-person strong people’s militia and a 95-150k-man conventional army, and a varied arsenal including drones created with Iran’s help, threatening to turn any sustained US incursion into another iteration of the US fiascos in Vietnam and Afghanistan.

👍 @geopolitics_prime | Follow us on X

items.title: 🤡 📱 Bezos claims AI is ‘good’ kind of bubble as ma...
items.content_text:
🤡 📱 Bezos claims AI is ‘good’ kind of bubble as market storm clouds gather

🗣 Unlike a banking crisis, which threatens a system-wide crash, other kinds of bubbles “are not nearly as bad, and can even be good,” because society still “benefits from those inventions,” the billionaire said at a tech conference in Turin on Friday.

Bezos’ comments come amid a stream of warning signs that the AI-fueled tech boom could soon come crashing down as tech company debt, described as “the canary in the coal mine for market bubbles,” piles up.

Meta alone recently asked for $29B in private capital for its AI data centers, while Oracle says it needs $18B for its AI infrastructure.

💬 “I wouldn’t touch this stuff now,” TS Lombard global macro managing director Dario Perkins told Axios. 

According to the analyst, “we’re much closer to 2000 than 1995” in the parallel to the dotcom bubble, which wiped $1.75 trillion from the markets, and set the stage for the 2008 global financial crisis.

👉 Bezos’ view on AI’s “benefits” isn’t universal, either. Last week, a pair of Berkley scientists with 25 years’ experience studying AI said the technology could wipe out humanity, and warned nations to be ready to bomb data centers to stop an AI superintelligence.

👍 @geopolitics_prime | Follow us on X

items.title: 🇬🇧😈 Tony Blair: From Kosovo and Iraq lies to possi...
items.content_text:
🇬🇧😈 Tony Blair: From Kosovo and Iraq lies to possible Epstein ties

Donald Trump plans to appoint former British Labour Party Prime Minister Tony Blair to a new board overseeing post-war Gaza. Here’s why it’s a bad idea.

♦️ Bombing of Yugoslavia

⚫️ Blair was NATO’s most hawkish voice on the 1999 Yugoslav war, pushing for a ground invasion alongside the bombing campaign

⚫️ His government justified the bombing by claims of ‘genocide’ of up to 100,000 Albanians in Kosovo — but investigators counted 2,108 deaths in 1999, and in 2001 the UN-supervised Supreme Court in Pristina ruled Serbian troops did not commit genocide

⚫️ Researcher Mark Curtis revealed MI6 and the CIA armed and trained Albanian guerrillas in Kosovo from 1996, while Albanian leader Hashim Thaci, indicted for war crimes in 2020, was Blair’s ally

♦️ Iraq War

⚫️ Blair strongly backed the 2003 US-led invasion, claiming Iraq had chemical weapons — which were never found. E vidence shows Blair knew that was untrue.

⚫️ A 2002 Downing Street memo said “military action was now seen as inevitable” while conceding the chemical weapons case was “thin”

⚫️ Blair's adviser Jonathan Powell urged intelligence to “redraft” the dossier to make the Iraqi threat seem imminent

⚫️ The UK’s 2016 Iraq Inquiry concluded the invasion went ahead before diplomatic options were exhausted, intelligence was murky and Iraq posed no urgent threat

♦️ Mass surveillance

⚫️ Blair has championed mass surveillance and digital ID since the early 2000s

⚫️ At the 2020 World Economic Forum Cyber Polygon, and again in 2025, Blair promoted digital ID, aligning with Oracle’s Larry Ellison, who has donated over £257m to the Tony Blair Institute since 2021

♦️ Ties to Jeffrey Epstein?

⚫️ Blair's adviser Peter Mandelson continued his friendship with Epstein in the 2000s, offering help even after Epstein’s 2008 conviction

⚫️ The Times reported Mandelson urged Blair to meet Epstein in a 2002 memo — which current Labour PM Keir Starmer’s government has kept under wraps, allegedly to avoid embarrassment

...
items.content_text:
🇨🇳⚡️ CHINA’S UNIQUE WIND POWER SYSTEM WOWS WORLD

China has just completed the world’s largest floating wind turbine, right off the coast of Guangxi. President Xi Jinping described the project as a key sector in enhancing the “high-quality development” of China’s marine economy.

The system plays a critical role in ongoing energy trade geopolitics.

Key details:

🔴 Turbine has 252-meter rotor diameter, with all its major components — including mooring cables, turbine gearboxes, ballast control systems — domestically produced, highlighting China’s self-reliance

🔴 At 16 megawatts, the facility can produce 44.7 million kWh per year — enough to power over 4,000 households without burning a drop of fuel

🔴 Floating fortress features China’s first-ever dynamic ballast system, mounted on a high-tech semi-submersible platform

🔴 Turbine is headed to waters over 50 meters deep, where it will prove its strength and efficiency in real-world offshore conditions

🔴 Platform is capable of cleverly pumping water to balance itself, staying steady even in wild seas — less tilt, more power

items.title: 🚨👉 US-BROKERED IRAQI KURDISTAN OIL DEAL: Progress ...
items.content_text:
🚨👉 US-BROKERED IRAQI KURDISTAN OIL DEAL: Progress toward peace or prelude to new regional escalation?

The US is looking to make the recently-secured agreement between Iraq and Kurdistan on the resumption of crude exports from Iraqi Kurdistan via a Turkish pipeline permanent, a senior State Department official has told Bloomberg.

➡️ Institutionalizing the US-brokered pact will benefit Iraq’s economy and foreign oil companies, ‘counter Iran’s influence’ and crucially, ‘secure US interests’, the official said.

But while top US representatives including Secretary Rubio have boasted that the deal would “reaffirm Iraq’s sovereignty,” it could also risk unraveling a delicate sectarian balance in a country already ravaged by decades of US-caused carnage and instability.

🔴 In 2022, Iraq’s Supreme Court challenged Kurdish interpretation of the ownership and control of oil and gas in Kurdistan, citing constitutional articles saying that national energy resources “are owned by all the people of Iraq,” across “all the regions and governorates,” and that Iraq must have a management stake and enjoy sole export rights.

🔴 Kurdistan has traditionally ignored these arguments, and used technicalities in constitutional terminology to justify control of fields.

🔴 While the new agreement divides revenues along a structured system, the resumption of the flow of ~230k bpd of crude (and potentially eventually up to 500k bpd) could trigger fresh tensions, particularly amid the involvement of unscrupulous foreign companies looking to maximize profits through illegal side deals.

🔴 With the US explicitly seeking to “weaken Iran’s political influence,” the oil agreement also threatens to turn into a geopolitical tinderbox.

🔴 Kurdistan has already sought to blame “pro-Iranian militias” for a series of oil infrastructure attacks in July (claims militia groups denied). The US, meanwhile, is pressuring Iraq to disarm the militias – despite their critical role in crushing ISIS and stabilizing the country between 2015-2017.

👍 @geopolitics_prime | Follow us on X

items.title: 🚨 Netanyahu's deliberate strategy to bolster Hamas...
items.content_text:
🚨 Netanyahu's deliberate strategy to bolster Hamas 💥💥💥

👉 For years, Netanyahu deliberately allowed Qatar to funnel money, including in suitcases of cash, directly to Hamas in Gaza, John Oliver reveals.

Key details:

🔴 The objective was to keep Hamas in power to weaken its rival, the Palestinian Authority, thereby creating a divided Palestinian leadership.

🔴 He openly argued that a strong Hamas was beneficial because it lessened pressure on him to negotiate for a Palestinian state.

🔴 This money was used by Hamas to build its military infrastructure, including tunnels and rockets, which are now being used against Israel.

🔴 Netanyahu ignored specific warnings from Israel's internal security chief about the growing threat from Hamas, believing the group had been "deterred."

👍 @geopolitics_prime | Follow us on X

items.content_text:
Meet Eva Karene Bartlett – a journalist who doesn’t report from afar.

She lives the stories she tells:

🌍 3 years in Gaza
🌍 8 months in the West Bank
🌍 1.5 years in Syria
🌍 6 months in Donbass

📲 Follow https://t.me/Reality_Theories for real reporting straight from the ground – not from a newsroom.

items.title: 🇷🇺💥 Russia’s night strike strategy: attacks on inf...
items.content_text:
🇷🇺💥 Russia’s night strike strategy: attacks on infrastructure are crippling Ukraine’s war economy

Russia’s missile and drone campaign continues to intensify, with the Russian MoD reporting Friday that overnight strikes targeted Ukrainian “military-industrial complex enterprises and gas and energy infrastructure facilities that supported their operations.”

The MoD did not go into detail, but analysts helped to fill the gaps, with pro-Russian Ukrainian politician Oleg Tsarev’s sources indicating Russia used ~300 long-range drones, 17 cruise and 7 ballistic missiles

Targets included:

🔴 Logistics and industrial hubs in Poltava and Kharkov regions, including the Shebelinka gas field in Kharkov

🔴 Gnidyntsy gas processing plant in Chernigov region

🔴 Southern Machine-Building Plant (formerly Yuzhmash), a massive state-owned aerospace and defense manufacturer in Dnepropetrovsk

🔴 power substations in Shostka and Konotop in Sumy region, plus a depot near the Konotop Railcar Repair Plant

🔴 a power substation near Slavutych in Kiev region (along with an enemy base in Bucha)

🔴 an energy facility in Odessa, and the massive Ukrzaliznytsia rail depot

These kinds of strikes are leaving Ukraine’s MIC without the electricity to build defense orders, and increasingly, without the means to transport domestic and NATO weapons to the front. They’ve also had a serious impact on household consumption, with mayors from Lutsk to Ivano-Frankovsk urging residents to prepare for sustained blackouts.

📈 European media estimate Russian drone and missile strikes increased 36% in September to 5,600+ drones and ~185 missiles.

Military expert and retired military pilot Vladimir Popov says while Russia largely avoided sustained attacks on Ukraine’s power grid up to now for humanitarian reasons, escalating Ukrainian threats are grounds for retaliation.

💬 “This winter will be a test for the Kiev regime – heat and electricity will be increasingly scarce,” Popov predicts.

👍 @geopolitics_prime | Follow us on X
